H4. Phasing Plan The development hereby permitted shall be built out in accordance with the Indicative Phasing Strategy ENF-JSE-HTA-A-RP-IPS Rev E dated December 2024 prepared by HTA Design LLP unless an updated Phasing Plan is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

H5. Compliance With EIA Mitigation MeasuresThe development shall be carried out in accordance with the mitigation measures set out in the Environmental Statement dated September 2022, Addendum dated April 2024, Chapter 8 Addendum dated June 2024, and Chapter 13 Addendum dated July 2024 and whenever the Local Planning Authority is requested to approve a variation to those mitigation measures or a non-material or minor amendment as provided by planning procedures, it shall only do so if it is satisfied that the proposed variation or amendment would not have any significant environmental effects which have not been assessed in the Environmental Statement. Reason: To ensure that the details of the development are within the parameters assessed in the Environmental Statement and that the development is carried out in accordance with the mitigation measures set out in the Environmental Statement in order to minimise the environmental effects of the development.

H13. Sound Attenuation The development shall be constructed/adapted so as to provide sufficient air-borne and structure-borne sound insulation against externally generated noise and vibration. This sound insulation shall ensure that the level of noise generated from external sources shall be no higher than 35 dB(A) from 7am - 11pm in bedrooms, living rooms and dining rooms and 30 dB(A) in bedrooms from 11pm - 7am measured as a LAeq,T. The LAF Max shall not exceed 45dB in bedrooms 11pm - 7am more than 10 times per night. Where the internal noise levels exceed the sound pressure levels stated in this condition with the windows open, a scheme for mitigation measures, including suitable alternative ventilation, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to above ground works taking place. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied/the use commences and take into account the Acoustics Ventilation & Overheating Guidance issued by the ANC and IOA.Reason: To protect the local amenity from noise and disturbance.

H14. Acoustic Report Prior to the completion of superstructure works for any development Plot an acoustic report, written in line with the methodology in BS4142:2014+A1 2019, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The report must set out the sound level generated from the mechanical plant at the development and state the noise control measures to be employed to ensure the noise from the plant does not exceed a level of 10dB below the typical measured background noise level measured as LA90 15 minutes during operational hours, at the fa√ßade of the nearest or most noise affected residential property.Reason: To protect the local amenity from noise and disturbance.

H15. All Non-Road Mobile MachineryAll Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/Reasons: In the interests of good air quality.

H16. Construction Logistics and Environmental Management PlanPrior to commencement of development of any Plot (other than including site investigations and archaeological investigation) a detailed Construction Logistics and Environmental Management Plan (CLEMP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Development shall be thereafter carried out in accordance with the CLEMP which shall remain in force for the entire demolition and construction period. For avoidance of doubt, this condition can be discharged either in the following stages: a.	Demolition works and construction up to and including ground floor slab and, b.	Construction works above ground floor slab. The CLEMP shall be informed by Construction Logistics Planning Guidance and must include as a minimum: i)	A plan showing the area to be surveyed to establish existing public highway condition:ii)	A pre-start record of the condition of the public highway identified by the plan referred to above, together with a written commitment to repair any damage caused by carrying out the developmentiii)	On-site parking and turning provision for site operatives, visitors and construction vehicles;iv)	Provision for the loading, unloading and storage of plant and materials within the site; v)	Location of temporary offices, contractors compounds and welfare facilities on the site; vi)	Details of points of access and egress to and from the site construction traffic; vii)	Details of signage at all vehicle exits from construction site advising drivers of preferred routes viii)	The erection of maintenance of security hoarding, including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing where appropriate;ix)	Works of demolition and construction shall only take place between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Monday to Friday and between 09.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays, and at no time on Sundays or Bank/Public Holidays; x)	Details of measures to prevent the deposition of mud and debris on the public highway, including wheel washing facilities and sheeting of vehicles transporting loose aggregates or similar materials off site;xi)	A Demolition and Construction Waste Management Plan that identifies the main waste materials, including vegetation, expected to be generated by the development, during demolition and construction, together with the measures for dealing with such materials so as to minimise waste and maximise re-use and recycling; xii)	Measure to ensure the safety of users of adjacent public highway during the construction period, in particular cyclist and pedestrians, especially at site access/egress points; xiii)	Measures to minimise emissions of dust from the site during construction written in accordance with the Mayor of London's supplementary planning guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' detailing how dust and emissions will be managed during demolition and construction work xiv)	Arrangements for temporary site lighting, including security lights, location and operations; xv)	Arrangements for liaising with other contractors in the vicinity of the site to maximise the potential for consolidated construction traffic movements to minimise traffic; xvi)	Procedures for maintaining good public relations, including compliant management, public consultations and liaison contact details and;xvii)	Details of a booking system for construction traffic to minimise the number of construction vehicles waiting on the public highway xviii)	Details of registration with the Considerate Contractors SchemeReason: To protect the environmental quality of the surrounding area, to safeguard the amenities of those living and working in the locality and in the interest of highway safety.

H17. Contaminated Land and Verification a) A Remedial Options Appraisal and/or Remediation Strategy giving full details of the remediation and mitigation measures required and how they are to be undertaken shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the development plot. b) Following completion of remediation, a Verification report setting out the details of the data collected in order to demonstrate that the works set out in the remediation strategy are complete to a satisfactory standard shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation of the development on the respective development Plot. Reason: To ensure that contaminated land is properly treated and made safe safeguard the health and safety of the future occupants.

H23. Digital Connectivity Prior to the occupation of each development Plot, all residential units and non-residential space within the respective development Plot shall be fitted with superfast broadband capability which shall be retained thereafter. Reason: to promote social inclusivity.

H24. Details of Boundary Treatments a. Prior to the commencement of any landscape works in any development Plot, details of all fences, walls, railings, gates and other boundary treatment, including to the roof terraces, for the relevant Plot shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.b. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the relevant Plot and permanently retained thereafter,Reason: In the interest of good design and privacy.

H25. Water Consumption Each dwelling (Use Class C3) hereby approved shall be designed to meet a target of 105litres or less per head per day.Reason: in order to protect and conserve water supplied and resources.

H26. Details of College Close Junction Prior to occupation of residential units in Block B, the full design and construction details of the alterations to the College Close junction to allow one way only (with left turn only from Sterling Way to College Close) shall be submitted to approved in writing by the Local Planning authority. The details to be submitted shall include: i)	How the scheme interfaces with the existing highway alignment ii)	Full signing and carriageway marking detailsiii)	Full construction details iv)	An independent Stage 2 Road Safety AuditThe approved details shall be constructed prior to the first occupation or operation of the relevant part of the development hereby approved.Reason: in the interests of highway safety and improved connectivity.

H27. Removal of Permitted Development Rights - Class E only Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), the commercial space identified on drawing ref. ENF-JSE-HTA-A-DR-XX-PL-PP07_Parameter Plan_Land Use-Ground Floor-K shall only be used for purposes within Class E of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2020 and for no other purpose.Reason: The impacts of the development have been assessed in the context of Class E uses and uses outside this use class could have different and potentially adverse impacts that have not been assessed or mitigated. Ensures the delivery of commercial floorspace that beneficially contributes to the character and amenities of the area.

H28.	Restriction of permitted development rights - Class C  Notwithstanding the development hereby permitted no permitted development rights are allowed to the dwelling houses under Schedule 2 Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). Reason: In order to protect the amenities of the adjoining occupiers, and to maintain a satisfactory appearance to the development.

H29. Telecommunication Apparatus a) Prior to occupation of a development Plot, details of any communal television and/or satellite system, if required for the residential dwellings within the relevant Plot, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. b) The approved system shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the residential units within the relevant Plot, maintained in working order and made available to each resident.c) No antennae or satellite dishes may be installed on the exterior of the buildings within the relevant Plot, with the exception of a single antennae or satellite dish per building to support the communal television and satellite system. The proposed antennae or satellite dishes shall be designed to minimise their visual impact. Reason: in the interests of the visual appearance of the buildings and social inclusivity.

H30. No plant or equipment fixed to external facades No roof plant, equipment, or other structures, other than as shown on the plans hereby approved or approved pursuant to a condition of this permission, shall be placed on the roof(s) or external fa√ßade or be permitted to project above the roofline of any part of the buildings as shown on elevational drawings or shall be permitted to extend outside of the roof plant enclosures of any buildings hereby permitted.Reason: to ensure high quality development and in the interest of visual amenity.

31. BREEAM Assessment - Non-Residential Within 6 months of the first operation of the commercial development in any development Plot, a post construction stage BREEAM New Construction 2018 shell and core accreditation certificate (or any such equivalent national measure of sustainable building which replaces that scheme) demonstrating a rating of no less than 'Excellent' (or such other rating as mat be agreed by the Local Planning Authority) (minimum score of 70%) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details approved and the accreditation of 'Excellent' shall be maintained as such thereafter, and no change there from shall take place without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason to ensure the development makes the fullest contributions to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.

H32. Tree Method Statement and Tree Retention Plan Prior to the commencement of development in each Plot a method statement shall be submitted to an approved by the Local Planning Authority,  (including site investigations and clearance and works of demolition), detailing retained trees within that Plot and any trees on adjacent land (as shown in Arboricultural  Impact Assessment & Method Statement (document ref. 02769Rv7 dated February 2024) prepared by Tamla Trees) shall be protected in accordance with BS5837:2012, with any tree work to be carried out in accordance with BS3998:2010 - Tree Work - Recommendations. The protection shall be retained intact for the full duration of the development within that development Plot until all equipment and materials have been removed from site. If the protection is damaged, all operations shall cease until it is repaired in accordance with the approved details. Nothing shall be stored or placed in any protected area in accordance with this condition and the ground levels within those areas shall not be altered, nor shall any excavations be made without the written approval of the local authority. Reason: To make sure that the trees on the site are adequately protected during building works and in the interests of visual amenity and biodiversity.

F1. Time Limit The Detailed Element of the development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of permission. Reason: As required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

F2. Drawings and Materials Detailed drawings and samples of all facing materials to be used in a development plot or phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any fa√ßade works on each respective development plot or phase in the Detailed Element hereby permitted development. The details and samples shall include the following: i.	Brick bonding and brick, including banding and decorative brick panel detail (annotated plans at a scale of not less than 1:20); ii.	External windows, spandrel panels, balconies, doors, screens, louvres, grilles and balustrading (annotated plans at a scale of not less than 1:10); iii.	Depth of window reveals and soffits (annotated plans at a scale of not less than 1:20) iv. Rainwater goods (annotated plans at a scale of not less than 1:10);iv.	The details shall show all joints between different materials and components, including walls, roofs, doors, windows, sills, lintels and fasciae, balconies, soffits and balustrades, external ramps, steps, pavements, boundary walls, gates, and fences.v.	Shop fronts, entrances and openings (annotated elevations and section details at a scale of not less than 1:20); vi.	vii. Sections of the landscaped areas of the scheme, showing the interface between soft and hard surface would work, the rainwater drainage strategy and associated technical solutions, and the interface between different pavements, the street, and the proposed buildings.a) No visible pipes or gutters shall be installed which were not included in the submitted drawings for this planning application.b) 1:1 sample bays showing a typical balcony and surrounding wall construction for the relevant development plot or phase shall be constructed for all detailed blocks to show details of junctions, materials prior to construction. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details and samples so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter, and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development is of a high standard

F3. Site Levels Notwithstanding the submitted information, prior to commencement of each relevant development  plot or phase within Detailed Element  phase of development hereby permitted (other than demolition, site clearance and preparatory works) plans detailing the proposed ground levels including the levels of any proposed buildings (including threshold, eaves and ridge heights), roads and/or hard surfaced areas, and access ramps shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure that levels have regard to the level of surrounding development, gradients, surface water drainage and to ensure ease of access throughout the site for all users.

F4. Quantum of Development The total quantum of the Detailed Element of the development hereby permitted shall not exceed the quantum's listed below: (i)	Residential (Use Class C3): 575 residential units; (ii)	Non-residential (Use Classes E(a), (b), (c), (e)) floorspace; 455 sqm (GIA)(iii)	Community (Use Class F2(b)) floorspace: 103sqm (GIA)Reason:  In order to ensure that the development is carried out in accordance with the approved plans and drawings and does not have any effects which have not been assessed in the Environmental Statement.

F5. Reserve Matters Application for Boundary Hall a) Prior to the demolition of Boundary Hall, a Reserved Matters Application (RMA) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for the following Reserved Matters: Appearance;Landscaping; and Access.b) Full particulars of these Reserved Matters, including plans, sections and elevations and all to an appropriate scale, and any other supporting documents shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for the purpose of obtaining their approval, in writing.c) The floorspace shall be a minimum of 362sqm and shall only be operated as Use Class F1(e) and/or F2(b).d) The meanwhile use shall be provided and be operational prior to the demolition of the existing Boundary Hall. e) The details shall include a replacement notice board. f) The meanwhile use shall be fully implemented in accordance with the approved details and retained until the permanent reprovision of community facilities in Block G.  Reason: to ensure continuity of community infrastructure.

F6. Permitted Uses: Community UseNotwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) the community floorspace in Block D shall be used for purposes within the F2(b) Use Classes only. Reason: In order to ensure that the development is carried out in accordance with the approved plans.

F7. Permitted Uses: Non Residential Uses a) Notwithstanding the provisions of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) the non-residential units in Block N as shown on the drawings hereby permitted shall be used only for the following purposes: Display or retail sale of goods, other than hot food (Use Class E(a)); Sale of food and drink for consumption (mostly) on the premises (Use Class E(b));. Provision of financial services, professional services (other than health or medical services), or other appropriate services in a commercial, business or service locality (Use Class E(c));. Medical services not attached to the residence of the practitioner (Use Class E(e)). b) Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), no change of use from Class E (commercial, business and service) to a use falling within Class C3 (dwellinghouses) shall take place.Reason: To safeguard the vitality and vibrancy of the district centre, allow for decant of existing units and to safeguard neighbouring properties and the area generally.

F8. Hours of Use: Non Residential Uses The following non-residential uses in the Detailed Element of the hereby permitted development shall not operate outside the following hours unless prior written approval from the Local Planning authority has been sought and granted:Class E(a) - Retail Use:7am - 11pm Monday to Saturday8am - 10pm Sundays and Bank HolidaysClass E(b) - Caf√©/Restaurant Use:7am - 11pm Monday to Saturday8am - 11pm Sundays and Bank HolidaysClass E(c) - Professional Services7am - 8pm Monday to Saturday9am - 6pm Sundays and Bank HolidaysClass E(e) - Medical / Health Services7am - 10pm Monday to Saturday7am - 8pm Sundays and Bank HolidaysReason: in the interests of protecting neighbouring occupiers living conditions.

F9. Details of the Energy CentrePrior to the above ground works of the Energy Centre in the Detailed Element of the development, a sample panel and a schedule of materials to be used in all external elevations including walls, doors, and windows on the building hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details. The Energy Centre shall be operational prior to the first occupation of any residential dwellings within Phase 0. Reason: in the interest of sustainable development.

F10. Energy and Overheating a) Notwithstanding the submitted information, prior to the commencement of each phase within the Detailed Element of the development hereby permitted, an updated Energy and Overheating Assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Energy Statement shall follow the energy hierarchy in the London Plan and be calculated through the Part L 2021 of the Building Regulations methodology SAP 10.2.b) The development shall be fully implemented in accordance with the approved details under part a) of this condition prior to the first occupation of development in each respective phase. c)Following the practical completion of any building within each respective phase of the Detailed Element, an updated Energy Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, reflecting the measures taken in practice in Be Lean, Be Clean and Be Green stages of the Energy hierarchy to reduce carbon emitted from the operation of a development and its services, as committed to in the design stage, and the Detailed New Development Carbon Compensation to be paid for the remaining emissions for the relevant phase.Reason: to ensure sustainability and carbon reduction.

F11. Details of Temporary Footbridge Full details of the temporary footway/ramp to the existing railway bridge shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any above ground works for Block D (other than site clearance and preparatory works). The details shall be fully implemented prior to the occupation of Block D in accordance with the approved details and maintained until a permanent replacement footway comes forward. Reason: to ensure continuity of community infrastructure.

F12. Heritage Plan and recording of Non-Designated Heritage Asseta) No demolition shall commence until a program of historic building recording and has been secured and undertaken in accordance with a written scheme of investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the planning authority. The historic building recording shall include capturing oral histories from current and former residents as well as the wider community.b) The applicant shall submit to the local planning authority an historic building report (to be submitted within six months of the completion of fieldwork, unless otherwise agreed in advance with the Planning Authority in consultation with the Greater London Archaeology Advice Service). This report shall be submitted to the Greater London Historic Environment Record and Local Studies Library in accordance with their guidelines and best practice.Reason: in the interest of mitigating harm to the non-designated heritage assets.
